title.narrative: Strengthening of MHPSS and GBV interventions for displaced and conflict-affected communities in northern Rakhine

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to address the unmet needs of survivors of gender-based violence (GBV) and women and girls at risk of GBV through the provision of strengthened Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) interventions, community mobilisation and strengthened health responses. UNFPA will use CERF to enhance the technical and institutional capacities of NGO and community-level partners to provide improved MHPSS and GBV services, and to distribute dignity kits and post-rape kits. The project will target 2,594 individuals who will receive specialist MHPSS and GBV services or training, and will indirectly benefit some 80,000 people. The project will be implemented within six months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA
